intro: Elaphoglossum proliferans, commonly known as the spreading harts-tongue fern, is a species of fern native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features dark green, leathery fronds with a distinctive, broad, tongue-shaped appearance. It produces small, spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its leaves. Elaphoglossum proliferans thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
